2164.subject: HDEV
2164.descrlong:
Middle childhood focuses on physical, cognitive, and socio-emotional development during the school age years (ages 6-11) with an emphasis on the various contexts in which children develop, such as cultural community, family, peer groups, and school.  This course offers a critical examination of developmental theories and research, and an exploration of the application of research in different social settings. (May be offered as classroom-based, hybrid, or online.) (Credit/No Credit Available) 

(Prereq: Junior or Senior Standing)
